commitResults.messageTitle: Added customised greeting and echo function to Duke.
Added the ability to store text entered by the user and display them back to the user when requested.
Added the ability to mark tasks as done.
Added support for tracking three types of tasks: ToDos, Deadlines and Events.
Minor changes to Duke.java to keep the format (capitalisation) of the input. Updated the test case.
1. Added the ability to handle errors, including invalid commands and insufficient information. 2. Updated the test case to test the ability to handle errors.
1. Added the ability to delete tasks from the list. 2. Updated the test case to test for the delete function.
Added the ability to save tasks in the hard disk automatically whenever the task list changes.

1. Updated the representation of date and time for deadlines and events. 2. Updated the test files to reflect this change. Assumption: the user always passes in the date and time in the right format. Improvement in the future: handle inputs in the wrong format.
Refactored the code to extract out closely related code as classes.
Organized the classes into suitable Java packages.
Added JUnit tests for 2 classes: Parser and Storage. To-do: add more JUnit tests for all public methods of all classes, including the UI component.
Minor changes to variable name in Ann.java.
Added the ability to find tasks that contain certain keywords. Removed a Manifest file that was accidentally created in the previous commit.
Add Javadoc comments for all classes.
Change some variable names to follow Java coding standards.
Change some files to follow the coding standard.
Change the build.gradle file to match project.
Fix coding style violations after running checkstyle.
Add a basic GUI to the app. Things to do: 1. handle exit command, 2. implement a proper UI component
Change the build.gradle file to update mainClassName to Launcher.
.gitignore, Storage class: fix bug to track files in the data folder
commitResults.messageBody:
.gitignore includes the path data/ which is supposed to refer to the local storage folder only, but is also the name of the package containing data classes such as Task.

The common name between the local storage folder and data package causes the data package to be ignored by git as the data/ path is included in .gitignore.

Changing the name of the local storage folder and replacing the data/ path in .gitignore with the new path to the local storage folder allows git to ignore the local storage folder only, while the data package is included in the git repository.

Let's rename the local storage folder to storageFolder, replace data/ in .gitignore with storageFolder/ and assign "storageFolder" to the constant DEFAULT_STORAGE_FOLDER_NAME in the Storage class.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add assert statements to multiple project files
commitResults.messageBody:
Possible bugs in the current code may lead to unexpected errors if not caught at the root.

Adding assert statements to various places in the code (e.g. in switch statements without a default case) allows the runtime to detect an assertion failure and terminate the execution with an error message.

Let's add assertion statements to places in the code which work only when certain assumptions about the program state are met.

Assertions are used instead of exceptions to check the internal logic of the code and ensure that it is correct, whereas exceptions are thrown for situations outside of the programmer's control.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix bug: recover data package
commitResults.messageBody:
The data package is missing from the repo (probably due to a bug during branching).

The data package contains essential classes such as Task which other classes depend on.

Let's copy the data package from another branch (branch-A-Assertions) into current branch.

branch-A-Assertions contains the most updated version of the data package.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix code quality issues
commitResults.messageBody:
Some method header comments are not in the recommended format, which affects the code quality.

Let's change these header comments to follow the recommended format.

The comments follow the format specified by the CS2103T website.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix bug that causes git to track local storage folder
Fix bug in parsing strings representing deadlines and events in local storage file
commitResults.messageBody:
Assertion errors are thrown from the factory methods in Deadline and Event classes indicating that the strings representing deadlines and events in the local storage file do not have the correct date and time format. There is a mistake in the assert statement - it assumes that the strings in the local storage follow the format for user input when in fact the user input format and the file format are different. After fixing this mistake, another bug is discovered - the parsing of deadlines and events from the local storage file is incorrect and inadvertently adds an extra white space between the date and time.

To prevent the assertion error, the incorrect assert statements should first be removed. Then, to ensure that the deadlines and events are parsed correctly from the storage file, the relevant methods in the Deadline and Event classes should be fixed.

Let's remove the assert statements in the factory methods of Deadline and Event. Let's also change the methods used to parse the date and time of deadlines and events in the Deadline and Event classes.

The assert statements in the factory methods of Deadline and Event are temporarily removed until a good method to check if the strings in the local storage file follow the file format is found.

commitResults.messageTitle: TaskList class: change the find method to enable better search (partial matching of keywords)
commitResults.messageBody:
The logic for executing the Find command is inside the find method of the TaskList class. The current find method only returns tasks that match all the inputted keywords. This limits the function of find as users may enter multiple keywords and the number of tasks that contain all those keywords in the inputted order may be few / none.

Changing the find method in the TaskList class to return tasks that match one or more of the keywords instead of all of them increases the number of matching tasks returned.

Let's change the find method in the TaskList class to add matching tasks for each inputted keyword to the returned string.

Returning the tasks that match one or more keywords improves the search quality and efficiency (users do not have to enter multiple Find commands for each keyword).
